title: Request: Change contact reference frame from global to local for msgs::Contact

content.raw:
Just realised that the reference frame for a contact point is the global frame. I would have expected the position being given in reference to the collision object frame.

In my use case I need to define different behaviour depending on where the contact point is on the collision model (Kobuki has 3 bumper sensors).

Is just me being confused by the current definition?
Or are there other reasons to do it the way it's currently done?
